headline: Brunch Enchiladas
description: A delicious breakfast casserole made with flour tortillas. Enchiladas filled with ham, vegetables and cheese and baked in a creamy egg batter.

video.description: Wonderful brunch option for a group!
video.name: Brunch Enchiladas

name: Brunch Enchiladas

recipeInstructions.text: Place ham in food processor, and pulse until finely ground. Mix together ham, green onions, and green peppers. Spoon 1/3 cup of the ham mixture and 3 tablespoons shredded cheese onto each tortilla, then roll up. Carefully place filled tortillas, seam side down, in a greased 9x13 baking dish.
In a medium bowl, mix together eggs, cream, and milk, flour, garlic powder, and hot pepper sauce. Pour egg mixture over tortillas. Cover, and refrigerate overnight.
The next morning, preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Bake, uncovered, in preheated oven for 50 to 60 minutes, or until set. Sprinkle casserole with remaining 1 cup shredded cheese. Bake about 3 minutes more, or until cheese melts. Let stand a least 10 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: This is wonderful! Have been making this for Christmas morning for years. I do substitute cooked bacon for the ham. Very easy if you pre-cook bacon and keep it in freezer. Onions and peppers are pre-cut day before along with egg mixture.

These were excellent! I made them lower carb by using low carb tortillas, and eliminating the flour. Added fresh spinach to the veggies and a combination of ground and chopped ham. Used 6 eggs, 1.25c of heavy cream and 1/2cup of almond milk and water to bring it to 2 cups total. Combination of cheese that was in the fridge. Will definitely make again!
this is amazing! I made it ahead of time and froze it for when we had lots of company. now I'm about to make another two pans of it and freeze it for more company!
It was very good. The tortilla shells were a little softer than I expected. I will make it again.

I read the reviews and made some changes. I added a 6th egg, used yellow instead of green pepper and substituted sausage for the ham. Everyone loved it. Being able to make it the night before is a great time saver.

Everyone loved it. I used ground breakfast sausage instead of ham. I browned the sausage with red bell pepper and the green onions. The ham would be good too but ground sausage was easier. Next time I plan to use the ham.

I don't have a food processor so just used shaved ham. No hot sauce, as kids would be eating it. I tried to roll the tortillas tightly, but the liquid didn't completely cover them, which I read in other reviews was a problem with no solution. I had to bake them 70 minutes until they were set. The end result was okay, but kinda plain and I would've preferred something else. I brought it to a potluck that had 20 attendees and I took half of it home, so it was a mediocre sell there as well. would skip it.
This was very tasty. The leftovers are really good too! I used sweet red pepper instead of green, but other than that followed the recipe.

Excellent, even in spite of the fact that I decided to make it last minute so the eggs did not soak the enchiladas overnight. I also left my ham in strips and chunks so as not to wake sleeping family members by using the food processor. Very tasty!
Pretty rich, but very good with Frank's (to season it to your own taste, especially in a bigger group)! Good brunch fare!
Very tasty! Kids loved it, even the ones that hate egg.

I read other reviews and used the tip about covering the tortillas completely so when baked are not hard. My family really liked this. I made this for my sons family for our Thanksgiving breakfast. Super easy recipe. Chris H.

Loved this recipe and will definitely make it again. The only change made was that we only used 4 flour tacos to put the ham filling in. 

Thinking about adding black beans into the food processor with the ham next time.

I added cooked chicken it was delicious 
Even the original recipe. Is perfect 
Thx
This was ok. I made it as listed with the exception of cutting it in half for the two of us, but I think it would have better with corn tortillas. I think I'll stick Huevos Rancheros.

I LOVED these enchiladas, served with AR Pico de Gallo, sour cream and avocado. Halved the recipe for the two of us.I substituted a blackened poblano for the green bell pepper as that's what I had on hand. Delicious! Added 1 teaspoon ground cumin and doubled the garlic powder and hot sauce. We like a lot of flavor and these did not disappoint! My husband isn't too keen on breakfast foods for dinner, but I loved them. He can eat the leftovers for breakfast!
I made it exactly as stated in the recipe. As other reviewers said I tried to get the egg mixture over all of the tortilla. It was very good. I will definitely make it again.
Delicious!! Great if your having company. prepare the night before and just pop it in in the morning.

We didn't have ham, so used breakfast sausage instead. We liked how the tortillas were a little crisp on the top. We felt it needed salt and pepper and perhaps some kind of cheesy sauce or salsa would be a nice addition. Would be great with pico de gallo.
I used turkey sausage instead of ham, and everyone loved it!
I made it for Sunday brunch for company. They raved about it.
everyone loved this new brunch dish and yes, I will make it again.
This was delicious. Made it for church breakfast and it was a hit. I used turkey crumbles instead of ham. Served it with salsa. Will make it again. Tmj
Not a fan of this recipe. Very little flavor
Everyone liked it. I think that the next time I'll make it, I'll leave the ham cubed.
I'm not giving a recipe review. Only want to comment on the fact that the nutrition data won't show. Please correct as this is important to a lot of us. Thanks

read definition for enchilada. this is not close. This is flour and egg casserole. Try corn tortillas softened in enchilada sauce. add scrambled eggs to ham mixture, roll and cover with sauce and cheese. Sort of like real breakfast enchiladas ;)
YUCK, soggy flour tortillas soaked in egg all night. Awful, simply awful.
I did not have overnight to chill the enchiladas so they chilled for about 2 hours and still turned out good. I think next time I will try bacon instead of ham.
Delicious! I made it for supper and did not refrigerate it overnight. I had to cover them after about 10 minutes t o keep them from burning on the top.
going to make again
Delicious recipe, but needs a little something! Maybe next time make a hollandaise sauce or something!

As written this is just ok, but with a few changes it's pretty great and gets rave reviews- definitely changes it to 5 stars! I chop the ham rather than putting it in the food processor. I omit the bell pepper. I reduce the half and half to 1 3/4 cups, omit the milk, and add 1 cup of green chiles, 1/2 tsp garlic powder, 1/2 tsp onion powder, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 1/2 tsp cumin, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/4 tsp cayenne, to the egg mixture. Everyone LOVED it!
I made this with chorizo instead of the ham. I just wanted more spice. It was AWESOME!!! Huge hit at Christmas brunch.
Great way to use leftover ham! I made exactly per recipe - whole family loved it.
Yes I'll make it again
I used fresh chives instead of onions,and used black forest ham.I didn't think it had very much flavor. It was actually better the second day. Haven't decided if I will make it again.

I will make it again! Easy directions, good photo. Thank you.
Ida
It turned out OK and I'll make it again but I'll place it under the broiler to crisp up.
i meab it was not the best thing in the world but i survived

We loved it. I hate to say this but I substituted sauted sausage meat for the ham. I hate it when people change ingredients . I used jalipeno/cheese flavored tortillas. I served it with 'mild' salsa and sour cream on top. I put tobascco on mine to add a little 'zip'

Lefty
Delishous!
Very bland and all around disappointing. Won't make it again!
I added a heaping tablespoon of chopped jalapeños and a T of cumin, it was a great way to use up leftover ham.

I liked the enchilada ingredients but didn't care for the baked eggs. It all seemed rather dry; I topped with salsa but that didn't go with the ham as much as I would have liked. I wouldn't make it again.
Awesome. Egg and cream set up beautifully. Added some chopped fresh cilantro and diced black olives to filling.
yummy!
Great taste and great that it is make-ahead. Top of the list for family vacations.
Love this recipe! I did take others advice on adding more egg and milk making sure the tortillas are covered.Turned out awesome. Will be making this again. Thanks

Great recipe for something different to make for brunch. I didn't mince my ham,cut it in tiny cubes and added small dice peppers, cumin, lime juice, jalapeños, and cilantro the ham mixture. I also blended the egg mixture really well and added about a tablespoon of cholula as well as salt and pepper and some cheese. I would advice the addition of foil about half through the baking time. That was increased to about an hour and ten minutes, just to make sure all the egg cooked through. Would definitely make it again.

This was fantastic! And very easy to make.
I will be making this again, thank you!

I made this for Easter. It was a huge hit! I used a pound of Jimmy Dean Hot Sausage instead of the ham. I also used a red and green pepper. It was fantastic! I served it with sour cream and black olives! Thank you for the wonderful recipe!

Very easily to make. I only found this recipe this morning, so no overnight in the fridge. I did however i add abit more milk and had it sit for 20 mins only before going into the oven. It worked out great. Will keep this in my recipe box!!!!

I followed the directions exactly and i think it came out bland. Needs some spice and also didn't care for the texture of the ground ham. If i make this again i will leave the ham cubed, add either sausage, bacon or maybe both. I will be adding minced garlic, chopped red onion and some Hatch green chiles! Also will be serving with sour cream and salsa.

These were super awesome! Loved them and can't wait to make them again. I took the advise of a few other reviews and added chopped green chilis and diced jalepenos. They gave just a little kick without overpowering or becoming too spicy for those with sensitive to heat palets.

It turned out great! I always change things. I used 1/2 lb sausage, because that's what I had. Added in 2T of home-made taco seasoning and 2 cups hash brown potatoes. Tore up corn tortillas, put half on bottom, then sausage mixture, then other half of tortillas. I used milk because it's what I had, and 6 eggs. Pour over casserole and let sit overnight. I used an 8x11 dish and it filled it perfectly, but took 2 hours at 350 to bake. . I'll be making this again!
RIQUISSIMAS!! They were really tasty!! Definetly next time they will be even better!
Really good make ahead breakfast! We also added some pickled jalapeños to the ham mixture. Will make again for sure!

After reading some of the reviews I made a few changes and this dish was wonderful! I put one additional egg to make sure that the tortillas were covered. They weren't totally covered with the egg/cream mixture but were in pretty deep. I cooked them with foil until the last ten minutes when I added cheese on top. Since there were vegetarians at the event I was going to, I filled the enchiladas with a mixture of carmelized onions, thawed frozen country hash browns and grated cheddar cheese. I used flour tortillas. They were fantastic. They disappeared from the buffet table. They were easy and tasted incredible.
These things turned out burnt on top and hard as rocks. The egg, milk, flour mixture acts like concrete mix and causes the tortillas to turn into little white boulders.

Omgosh, these are sooo yummy! For the filling, I used a combination of ham, half a can of refried beans, half a can of pinto beans, half a small can of green chilies, half a small can of jalepeno peppers, and an tomato/onion/pepper blend found in the produce section at my local grocer. I used monterey jack cheese inside the filling and used the cheddar for the topping. I spread some salsa over the burritos before adding the cheese. This could totally be a vegetarian dish if you want to omit the ham. If you modify this recipe with the ingredients I used, this will be a mexican dish packed with flavor a hint of a kick. The half and half/ egg mixture provides such flavor and creamy goodness.

I've made this dish several times, prepping it a day before going on a road trip vacation. Everyone always asks me to bring it the next time. It's quite easy to make and nice that you can prepare it ahead of time and then just throw it in the oven the day you want to eat it.

I loved this recipe. I don't' care for ham, so I used ground breakfast sausage. I also threw in some southwest breakfast potatoes. I used corn tortillas because they aren't as filling as flour, I love these things! I topped them off with deseeded and minced jalapenos. Make sure you cover all the tortillas or they will get hard while baking. So good!!! Instead of putting the corn tortillas in hot oil to soften, you can run them in simmering chicken broth.

Our guests really enjoyed this and we liked it, too, though I can't say for certain I'd make it again. I didn't love the texture of the tortillas. I appreciate that it's makeaheadable and was quite easy to throw together. I served it w/sour cream and salsa, which were a nice accompaniment. THANKS for the recipe, DBLUNCK!

It is hard to rate this recipe as I used it only for the idea and guide. I fried 4 slices of bacon almost done then added onions to pan after some time added canned potatoes(diced),diced ham and some mushrooms then 1 can green chilies. scrabbled 7 eggs with milk and cheese and some taco seasoning poured over all this and cooked till eggs were set. I used the (as someone suggested)recipe for 10 minute enchilada sauce. used reg flour it worked fine. put a TLB of sauce on tortilla, egg filling ,grated cheese ,top of spring onions chopped and baked as directed. Now this was some mighty fine eating. I would have to give myself a 5 star...

Updated 2/17/2015: My version of this recipe is a real hit with family and friends. I replace the ham with 1/2 pound each of cooked sage or country style sausage and chorizo sausage. Instead of green bell's, I use red bell for the sweetness and add 1/2 cup of chopped roasted mild green chilies. For my taste, I would add jalapeno's, but since most of my friends and family have a tame palate, I leave the hot stuff on the side. I also replaced the cheddar with a Mexican cheese blend. You could also use oaxaca or asadero cheese in this recipe. I add an extra egg (6 eggs total). For seasoning, I add 1/2 tsp of kosher salt, freshly ground black pepper (to taste), and a "special" ingredient...1/2 tsp smoked paprika. The paprika goes very well with the chorizo and adds a bit more smoke flavor. Also, if you really want to turn up the flavor, make your own tortillas! 

Thanks for this recipe DBLUNCK!
I forgot to add the last round of cheese before baking, but they seemed to go over well at the brunch where I made them.

I would have rated a 5 but the egg mixture did not cover the enchiladas. My solution was to remove after cooking for 20-30 minutes or just before the enchalidas brown on top. I took the back of a spoon and pushed down till egg mixture moistened the enchalidas. They were fine but the next time I will make one and half the egg portion. The taste was really excellent and and different than the usual sausage fare everyone makes. Good for Christmas breakfast that can be put together ahead.
YUM!!!! no need to change a thing!!!! I make this several times throughtout the year & it's always a big hit!

these were good, although a little milder than I anticipated. I added some fresh mushrooms to the green onion and bell pepper mix, which we really enjoyed. I think some green chili's would have been really good as well. Do let these sit overnight as that is what appears to thicken the sauce up. I didn't, and they had to bake longer than the recipe states.

I make this recipe quite often and everyone loves it. Since I'm not a bacon fan I use breakfast sausage instead. I also end up having to double the egg mixture. I put toothpicks in each Enchilada so that they do not unwrap and stay at the bottom of the pan whilerefrigerated.
Amazing! The best breakfast enchiladas I've ever tried. I used 1 lb. sausage instead of the ham, and added some salsa to each tortilla. Wish I could give better than 5 stars!!
These were a hit at my Christmas morning brunch.
Under-whelmed. Wouldn't make again.

I used sausage in place of the ham, corn tortillas instead of the flour tortillas, and added a can of diced green chiles and these were delicious! Great recipe that I'm sure would have been fantastic as written, I just used what I had on hand.
Excellent!
This was wonderful. Family and friends raved! Will definitely make these again.

***With very few changes it's 5 stars!*** This was awesome! And wonderful to have all prep work done to just simply throw in oven Christmas morning! I made very few changes: I doubled the liquid mixture so that it completely covered the tortillas/enchiladas as another reviewer suggested, substituting green onions for a small yellow onion instead. Adding this additional liquid mixture was definitely a must! But because of this, more liquid to cook, I ended up keeping it in the oven probably another 30-45 minutes. Also, I put a ton of cheese on top and baked after that for about 10-15 minutes instead of the cook's suggestion for only 3. This was really very good and we will definitely make it again! Thank you so much for such an easy, crowd pleasing meal! It was incredible!
These were Delicious! I used sausage instead of Ham but otherwise followed the recipe. Got lots of compliments and requests for the recipe.
I make this for our staff breakfasts and it is one of the first dishes gone every time. It's a great recipe to experiment with. I use green chilis instead of the peppers and it's yummy!
DELICIOUS! Several people asked for the recipe!

I made these with my leftover ham from Thanksgiving. I heeded the other reviewers and covered while baking the first 45 minutes. I also added frozen peas. I seasoned the meat/green onion/pea mixture with cumin, white pepper, salt and cracked pepper (I was conservative because it was for a church brunch but will be more liberal next time). I made sure to cover the tortillas with the cream/egg mixture while soaking and cooking. I added another egg and more cream/milk to make sure it was covered. Also, I think it's important to grease the dish - if you don't they might stick b/c of the eggs. It actually turned out pretty and tasted pretty good. I like my food spicy so I am sure when I make it again it will be better - I didn't not add the hot sauce - that would have been delicious I think. A perfect brunch dish. My dish was empty when I left church so I think it was a hit. I also served it with sour cream and "On the Border" brand salsa. Thanks for the recipe!
Awesome! My husband loves these. I used mild sausage instead of the ham, fat-free half and half and skim milk. Next time I want to try it with the ham! Served with salsa, sour cream, and hashbrowns.

YUM! I made this exactly as written except I added bacon. These were absolutely delicious. The prep time is extensive but they are totally worth it. (I didn't process the ham though, I only chopped it because pureed ham seems weird). Sausage or hashbrowns would also taste great in the tortillas as would mushrooms. These could work like an omelete, you could add or take things out based on personal taste. I plan on serving these for Christmas breakfast. They look and taste fantastic. One piece of advice, don't try to cram too many tortillas in the pan, this will cause them to not lay flat in the pan, which will lead to them not be submerged enough in the egg mixture and then the tortillas will harden.

These were a hit at my work potluck. Instead of Ham, I used cooked breakfast sausage crumbles and followed the rest of the recipe as it's written. These enchiladas were to die for. I had many people ask me for the recipe and request I make them again.

I made this for our park brunch & received great comments. I used 1 pound cooked sausage & used 2 1/2 cups milk no cream. After reading all the reviews, I was very concerned about the flour tortillas becoming hard during baking. After pouring the egg mixture on top, I pushed the flour tortillas into the mixture. The next morning & before cooking I spooned the egg mixture on top of the tortillas and the tortillas were not hard after baking. I would make this again!

Delicious recipe, was a huge hit! I substituted green chilis for the bell pepper and they were delicious. Also made half with ham and half with bacon. As others noted, the ends of the tortillas got a little burnt/crispy so my advice would be to keep some of the egg mixture out and pour it over the ends half-way through cooking or so. Otherwise, a great recipe and I'll make it again!

Loved this recipe....My family gets tired of the usual breakfast of eggs, either scrambled or omeletes. The only thing I didn't have was half and half I just used 1 one cup of milk and it still turned out yummy. I also cut the recipe in half and only used 6 egss. Instead of ham (didn't have any on hand) I fried up some scrapple. The scrapple made the enchilada. I will definitely make this again. I am gonna maybe use sausage next. Thanx for the great recipe and changing up our usual breakfast routine.
Great recipe, I used sausage instead of ham. Turned out great and super easy since you can assemble the night before!
Delicious! Great flavor. Will make these again. Could add many other vegetables.

These were awesome! I did make a few changes, but I think it's a recipe that will turn out great regardless...I used orange and yellow bell pepper, and crumbled bacon and black beans instead of ham. I also added a can of small green chilles, used a few more eggs, and probably more cheese. I let it sit overnight. Served with salsa and sour cream. It was a big hit and leftovers were great the next day!
These are a great alternative to the other brunch casseroles. Love this!
I make this every time I host a brunch. I don't eat ham so I swap it out for cooked hot italian chicken sausage

Very good and I followed others advice to push down the tortillas in the egg batter several times and they came out soft. I did tweak to my liking but a great basic recipe; thanks for sharing. I added 2 Tbsp. Dijon-mustard to the ham filling which was a nice addition for me otherwise made as is and was excellent.
Excellent Recipe! I was hesitant with the method of preparation prior to making them but WOW were they amazing. A huge hit with the group I made them for. Will keep this recipe for a long time!
Super easy. Everyone loved it. Thanks!

This made a hit on Easter morning. I was skeptical but am glad I tried it. My one thought is about grinding the ham. I think you could just chop the ham instead. We were all a little put off by the texture of ground ham. Flavor was fantastic! I did not have green onion so used a regualr and that was just fine.
Made this x4 for a crowd. Several commented that it was very good (at 6 a.m. it's nice to get comments from anyone).

good and something different than your basic egg caserole. I would suggest puting foil on the top though cuz when the cheese cooks and gets hard, it's hard to cut through and eat when it's crunchy on top.
